attributes.action: Bring Flight of the Conchords to the O2 or another UK venue
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Amid the gloom of the economic crisis, consumer spending is stagnant and moods are low.

There is only one realistic way to catalyse an improvement in the UK's prosperity: bring Flight of the Conchords to the UK and allow 50,000 or so people to watch them play.

Additional capital will be injected into the economic system, and the resulting optimism and joy will surely create boundless opportunities for UK business, entrepreneurs and indeed everyone else.

Gordon Brown, you have the power to do this.

Forget recapitalising the banking system. Cut straight to the funny bone.

Get New Zealand's second most popular folk parady duo to play us back into prosperity

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
